title: Commerce Department preparing to turn on initial version of space traffic coordination service
summary: The Department of Commerce remains on schedule to begin the initial version of its space traffic coordination service by the end of September while it works to add capabilities to it.

title: Interior of Vacuum Tank at the Electric Propulsion Laboratory
summary: Interior of the 20-foot diameter vacuum tank at the NASA Lewis Research Center’s Electric Propulsion Laboratory. The Electric Propulsion Laboratory, which began operation in 1961, contained two large vacuum tanks capable of simulating a space environment. The tanks were designed especially for testing ion and plasma thrusters and spacecraft. The larger 25-foot diameter tank included […]

title: Starship is Getting a New Environmental Assessment
summary: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has released the details on the new Tiered Environmental Assessment (TEA) for Starbase. This proposal will help SpaceX expand operations in Starbase and better define operations for the Starship program.

title: Calling All Innovators: Apply for NASA’s 2025 Lunabotics Challenge
summary: NASA invites teams from colleges, universities, as well as technical and vocational schools around the country to test their engineering skills in the 2025 Lunabotics Challenge. Applications open at 5 p.m. EDT on Friday, Sept. 6. The competition is aimed at inspiring Artemis Generation students to explore science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) for the […]

title: A new report finds Boeing’s rockets are built with an unqualified work force
summary: NASA declines to penalize Boeing for the deficiencies.

title: Australia Joins US-Led Landsat Next Program
summary: As the United States prepares to shift from the legacy Landsat program to the next generation Landsat Next constellation, new players in space have been integrated with the program to support broad reaching global observation. Australia has formally joined the United States-led Landsat Next satellite program as a core partner, building on nearly half a century of collaboration in satellite land imaging across the globe.

title: Sedimentary and Planetary Geologist Dr. Michael Thorpe
summary: “I didn’t always grow up knowing that I was going to be working for NASA. It was just the way my life unfolded, and I couldn’t be more grateful and lucky to have this opportunity to be here. I think hiking is what really got me into my passion for wanting to have this outdoors […]

title: Communications Strategist Thalia Patrinos
summary: The public perception of NASA has a lot to do with our technological successes and the discoveries that we’ve made, but none of that is possible without the people.  “In the six or so years that I’ve worked at NASA, I’ve learned a lot of incredible stories — not just of the struggles that different...

title: How NASA Citizen Science Fuels Future Exoplanet Research
summary: NASA’s upcoming flagship astrophysics missions, the Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope and the Habitable Worlds Observatory, will study planets outside our solar system, known as exoplanets. Over 5,000 exoplanets have been confirmed to date — and given that scientists estimate at least one exoplanet exists for every star in the sky, the hunt has just […]

title: Gabrielle Carlisle, Millennium Space Systems – Leading Women in Space
summary: In this episode of the SpaceNews Leading Women in Space series, correspondent Debra Werner speaks with Gabrielle Carlisle, Vice President, Manufacturing, Supply Chain & Logistics, Millennium Space Systems.
